results.title: The West Indies: Caribbean region 1
results.brief_description: Historical overview of the West Indies. Shows the principal West Indies Islands, their strategic and economic value to the western world, their topography, climate, industries, and the peoples who live there today.

results.title: The Well of the saints
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Yust
results.brief_description: A traditional Irish folk drama by John M. Synge, set in the east of Ireland, two or three centuries ago. The satiric theme - that sometimes it is better to preserve one’s illusions than to face reality - is expressed through the episode of Martin and Mary Doul’s miraculously restored sight. Part of the “Short play showcase” series.

results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Sandra Levy and Samantha Lang
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: The weeping earth: salt in South Eastern Australia
results.brief_description: Dr Jim Bowler introduces a program addressing the scourge of the Australian land - salt - a side effect of settlement and clearing. Discusses the situation before European settlement and examines why salt is such a problem by looking at the history of the Australian landscape.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 300
results.brief_description: Magazine style newsreel with four short pieces. 1. Alex Carr the lion tamer from Bertrand Mills Circus puts the lions through their paces. 2. Shows how road research is helping to design better and safer roads. 3. London fashion review. Shows actress Moira Lister modelling clothes and someone who looks remarkably like Audrey Hepburn. 4. Comedy piece with Sam Costa and the Mayfair club with drinks at 1939 prices. Issue number 300.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 296
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage. Includes: 1. Clock built into pavement. 2. In the park, bag snatcher repelled with dye. 3. Hair stylist “experimental hairdo”. 4. Wartime frogman and expert driver - exploring the depths of the Mediterranean. Underwater photography, concentrating on its potential to assist salvage operations, and marine science in general.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 294
results.brief_description: Newsreel items include: The happenings and description of charm schools; renowned variety stars - The Voltaires; pupils at the Royal Navy Gunnery School get cracking under realistic training conditions; the World’s largest road vehicle, The Antar, on display before being shipped to the Middle east; Joe Davis, snooker champion shows of his skilled wares at the table.
